C. De Marco, a Montella. text:
"Nothing is more real than nothing. Superstitions and Fantastic Creatures ‚Äùarrives in Montella
07 Nov 2019, 16:18 by Redazione

Where Villa E.C. De Marco Montella
When From 08/11/2019 to 10/11/2019

The cultural side of the 37th Montella IGP chestnut festival is enriched in the discussion of folkloric themes related to Superstition, through the experiential exhibition entitled "Nothing is more real than nothing" - Superstitions and Fantastic Creatures.
After the great success of the exhibition organized at Villa Amendola during the Avellino Summer Fest 2019 and the 18th mountain festival in Acerno, the event, promoted by the Monti Picentini Regional Park, the Municipality of Montella and the FAI Giovani Avellino, is will take place in the wonderful Villa EC De Marco, in Montella. It will be an immersive experience in the symbols that bind Irpinia to superstitious beliefs and fantastic creatures, a journey that pushes us to reflect on how we represent to ourselves the concepts of evil and the monstrous, the unknowable and the unknown.
The mayor Rizieri Buonopane, the president of the Monti Picentini Regional Park Fabio Guerriero and the FAI Giovani Avellino group together with the organizing committee, the lawyer. Davide Urciuolo, the arch. Valentina Fiore and Dr. Serena Giuditta, will be pleased to welcome you at the inauguration of the experiential exhibition at Villa E.C. De Marco Friday 8 November at 17:00. Visits to the public are only possible on 8, 9 and 10 November from 10:00 to 13:00 and from 17:00 to 22:00.
Admission is free with a suggested voluntary contribution of ‚Ç¨ 3.00 to support the cause of FAI - Fondo Ambiente Italiano. On this occasion, you can register for the FAI at reduced rates: from 18 to 35 years, enrollment in the FAI will be possible at a fee of ‚Ç¨ 15.00.
